qas.question: In what industry has videoconferencing become useful?

What year was the movie Frozen released?

plausible_answers.text: creative talent in many different locations can collaborate closely on the complex details of film production

qas.question: How has videoconferencing become useful in the songwriting industry?
In what industry has using different locations become useful?
In what year was the film industry globalized?
How long did songwriters work in different locations through videoconferencing?
On what movie were complex details of film production used?

context: In the increasingly globalized <a0_0><b6_0>film<a0_0/> industry<b6_0/>, videoconferencing has become useful as a method by which <b5_0>creative talent in many different locations can collaborate closely on the complex details of film production<b5_0/>. For example, for the <a2_0><b7_0>2013<b7_0/><a2_0/> award-winning animated film <a1_0><b9_0>Frozen<b9_0/><a1_0/>, Burbank-based Walt Disney Animation Studios hired the <a3_0>New York City<a3_0/>-based husband-and-wife songwriting team of Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez to write the songs, which required two-hour-long transcontinental videoconferences nearly every weekday for about <a4_0><b8_0>14<b8_0/><a4_0/> months.
